title-group.article-title: GABA TRANSAMINASE DEFICIENCY WITH SURVIVAL INTO ADULTHOOD

article-meta.aff: 3Boston Children’s Hospital, Harvard Medical School, Boston, MA, USA

Ethical Approval: This research is a part of an approved protocol through the institutional review board/ethics committee at Boston Children’s Hospital (IRB-P00011862).

abstract.p: GABA-transaminase deficiency is an ultra-rare disorder of GABA metabolism that was described for decades as an early onset epileptic encephalopathy plus movement disorder and hypersomnolence with mortality in early childhood. We report two affected siblings in adolescence and adulthood, both with profound developmental impairment, intractable epilepsy, movement disorder, and behavioral fluctuations. This considerably expands the phenotype and longevity of this inherited neurotransmitter disease.
